Rules
* Please specify whether each round is independent, and whether opponents' previous moves (provided as input) are for reference only (e.g. to allow the player to compute the score since no score is given as input) and have no effect on the current round.

Elimination
* Please refer to the page below as a reference:

https://www.codingame.com/ide/puzzle/git-patchwork

Review the HTML code of the sections "Victory Conditions" and "Defeat Conditions", then:

  â€¢ Add a similar "Victory Conditions" section for your game.

  â€¢ Replace "Elimination" with "Defeat Conditions".

* Please change "format (each line must be "opponent_id move")" to "output format".

* Please replace "'C' or 'D'" with "<const>C</const> or <const>D</const>" (without any quotation marks).

Example
* Please begin "Turn 1 Input" in a separate paragraph.

* Consider formatting inputs and outputs (e.g. "0 2", "1 C 2 C") using <const> tags for clarity.

Input, Output, Constraints
* Please refer to the HTML code of the above-referenced page to format these sections properly (e.g. by adding <div class="statement-section statement-protocol">).

* Please remove all single quotation marks around the characters C, D and N.

* The variable "turns" is undefined. Please replace "<var>turns</var>" with "Maximum number of turns".

Referee
* The referee appears to crash whenever the output is invalid (e.g. "1", or "0 D" when I'm player 0). Please fix the issue.

Thanks.
Could you please keep your contribution's status Private if it's not ready yet? Thanks.

Thanks for the feedback. I believe I've fixed all the formatting issues. 
I've change the ids to be virtual and so everyone's own id is zero. The referee should no longer crash on invalid outputs.

The game looks much improved now!

Rules
* Please specify whether each round is independent, and whether opponents' previous moves (provided as input) are for reference only (e.g. to allow the player to compute the score since no score is given as input) and have no effect on the current round.

Victory Conditions
* Consider reordering the conditions, and rewriting the earlier possible victory condition as follows:

  â€¢ If at any point only one player remains active, that player wins and the game ends immediately.

Defeat Conditions
* Please change "format (each line must be "opponent_id move")" to "output format". If you want to keep the original wording, please format "opponent_id" and "move" using the <var> tag.

Input for one game turn
* [[move]] is not an integer. Please change "integers" to "values" and then add "(integer)" after "ID".

Viewer
* Consider increasing the font size.

**********

I don't think I've ever seen an 8-player bot game here before. My guess is that this configuration might be causing issues with the last-battle UI, which normally supports up to 4 players.

As a quick test, I submitted a bot that outputs C for every opponent, and the ranking appeared to get stuck (you can check the leaderboard). By contrast, I submitted a bot that outputs random on every turn in "Animal Chess" ( https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/5509706f8b0072d4f52b280f2ac7ba29f0ca7 ), and the last-battle UI popped up and displayed 10 games that all started and finished correctly. You're welcome to try this yourself.

That said, I'm not certain about the exact cause of the issue. While the 8-player setup seems like a likely explanation, it could also be something else.

(I'm aware that the SDK documentation states the maximum number of players is 8, butâ€¦)

Thanks.

I updated the formatting. 
I think the issue was I set min players to 8. Now, min-players is at 2 and the last battles are recorded and showing. 

Thanks again,

Viewer
* Consider increasing the font size in the viewer, i.e. the section where the score graph is displayed.

* Are you going to add an opening sequence (shown when the puzzle page is loaded or refreshed)?

* Are you going to add a score summary screen (shown when a game is over)?

Statement
* Please restore the font size. There may have been a misunderstanding; the font size of the *statement* was increased, but my earlier comment referred to the viewer, not the statement.

Number of players
* Reducing the minimum players appears to have resolved the issue. However, we should wait and see whether games with 5 or more players run without issues. It seems that bots are used only in the IDE and not in the arena (otherwise, they would likely be filling any open slots).

Thanks.
Viewer font is increased. The Statement font is back to normal. Score Summary scene is added. I will add bots to the arena. I plan on adding an opening sequence but I'm still working on it.

Viewer font: It looks much better now; I can read it clearly. You could consider increasing the size just a little more, but I'll leave that to your judgement.

Add bots to arena: I don't know how to do so, but if you've figured out how, please go ahead and add them, and teach me as well ðŸ™‚

Opening sequence: Noted.

Thanks.
